<p><b>Bastian Schweinsteiger</b> (<span class="rt-commentedText nowrap"><span class="IPA nopopups noexcerpt" lang="en-fonipa"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:IPA/English" title="Help:IPA/English">/<span style="border-bottom:1px dotted"><span title="/ˈ/: primary stress follows">ˈ</span><span title="/ʃ/: &#39;sh&#39; in &#39;shy&#39;">ʃ</span><span title="&#39;w&#39; in &#39;wind&#39;">w</span><span title="/aɪ/: &#39;i&#39; in &#39;tide&#39;">aɪ</span><span title="&#39;n&#39; in &#39;nigh&#39;">n</span><span title="/ʃ/: &#39;sh&#39; in &#39;shy&#39;">ʃ</span><span title="&#39;t&#39; in &#39;tie&#39;">t</span><span title="/aɪ/: &#39;i&#39; in &#39;tide&#39;">aɪ</span><span title="/ɡ/: &#39;g&#39; in &#39;guy&#39;">ɡ</span><span title="/ər/: &#39;er&#39; in &#39;letter&#39;">ər</span></span>/</a></span></span> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:Pronunciation_respelling_key" title="Help:Pronunciation respelling key"><i title="English pronunciation respelling"><span style="font-size:90%">SHWYNE</span>-shty-gər</i></a>, <style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1177148991">.mw-parser-output .IPA-label-small{font-size:85%}.mw-parser-output .references .IPA-label-small,.mw-parser-output .infobox .IPA-label-small,.mw-parser-output .navbox .IPA-label-small{font-size:100%}</style><span class="IPA-label IPA-label-small">German:</span> <span class="IPA nowrap" lang="de-Latn-fonipa"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:IPA/Standard_German" title="Help:IPA/Standard German">[ˈbasti̯a(ː)n<span class="wrap"> </span>ˈʃvaɪnʃtaɪɡɐ]</a></span> <span class="ext-phonos"><span data-nosnippet="" id="ooui-php-1" class="noexcerpt ext-phonos-PhonosButton ext-phonos-PhonosButton-emptylabel oo-ui-widget oo-ui-widget-enabled oo-ui-buttonElement oo-ui-buttonElement-frameless oo-ui-iconElement oo-ui-buttonWidget" data-ooui="{&quot;_&quot;:&quot;mw.Phonos.PhonosButton&quot;,&quot;href&quot;:&quot;\/\/upload.wikimedia.org\/wikipedia\/commons\/transcoded\/1\/16\/De-Bastian_Schweinsteiger.ogg\/De-Bastian_Schweinsteiger.ogg.mp3&quot;,&quot;rel&quot;:[&quot;nofollow&quot;],&quot;framed&quot;:false,&quot;icon&quot;:&quot;volumeUp&quot;,&quot;data&quot;:{&quot;ipa&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;lang&quot;:&quot;en&quot;,&quot;wikibase&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;file&quot;:&quot;De-Bastian Schweinsteiger.ogg&quot;},&quot;classes&quot;:[&quot;noexcerpt&quot;,&quot;ext-phonos-PhonosButton&quot;,&quot;ext-phonos-PhonosButton-emptylabel&quot;]}"><a role="button" tabindex="0" href="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/transcoded/1/16/De-Bastian_Schweinsteiger.ogg/De-Bastian_Schweinsteiger.ogg.mp3" rel="nofollow" aria-label="Play audio" title="Play audio" class="oo-ui-buttonElement-button"><span class="oo-ui-iconElement-icon oo-ui-icon-volumeUp"></span><span class="oo-ui-labelElement-label"></span><span class="oo-ui-indicatorElement-indicator oo-ui-indicatorElement-noIndicator"></span></a></span><sup class="ext-phonos-attribution noexcerpt navigation-not-searchable"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:De-Bastian_Schweinsteiger.ogg" title="File:De-Bastian Schweinsteiger.ogg">ⓘ</a></sup></span>; born 1 August 1984) is a German former professional <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midfielder" title="Midfielder">midfielder</a>. Earlier in his career, he primarily played as a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wide_midfielder" class="mw-redirect" title="Wide midfielder">wide midfielder</a> before later switching to a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_midfield" class="mw-redirect" title="Central midfield">central midfield</a> role. Former Germany national team manager <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joachim_L%C3%B6w" title="Joachim Löw">Joachim Löw</a> has referred to Schweinsteiger as one of the greatest players the country has ever produced.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-3"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>3<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Schweinsteiger spent 17 seasons at <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_Bayern_Munich" title="FC Bayern Munich">Bayern Munich</a>, playing in exactly 500 matches across all competitions and scoring 68 goals. His honours at the club include eight <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bundesliga" title="Bundesliga">Bundesliga</a> titles, seven <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DFB-Pokal" title="DFB-Pokal">DFB-Pokal</a> titles, a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a> title, a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_Club_World_Cup" title="FIFA Club World Cup">FIFA Club World Cup</a> title and a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Super_Cup" title="UEFA Super Cup">UEFA Super Cup</a> title.<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-4"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>4<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He joined <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United</a> in 2015, playing sparingly for 18 months before moving to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago_Fire_FC" title="Chicago Fire FC">Chicago Fire</a>. He announced his retirement from playing in October 2019.
</p><p>Schweinsteiger played for the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_national_football_team" title="Germany national football team">German national team</a> from 2004 to 2016. He is Germany's fourth-most-capped player of all time, having earned <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_men%27s_footballers_with_100_or_more_international_caps" title="List of men&#39;s footballers with 100 or more international caps">121 caps</a> and scored 24 goals. He was selected in their squads for four European Championships and three World Cups, including their victory at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 FIFA World Cup</a>, when he was widely regarded as one of the most important contributors in Germany's campaign, playing an especially important role in defending <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a> in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_Final" class="mw-redirect" title="2014 FIFA World Cup Final">final</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-5"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>5<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Following <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philipp_Lahm" title="Philipp Lahm">Philipp Lahm</a>'s international retirement on 2 September 2014, Schweinsteiger was named <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain_(association_football)" title="Captain (association football)">captain</a> of the national team. He played his last match for Germany against Finland on 31 August 2016, after which he retired from international football.
</p><p>Since his retirement as a player in 2019, Schweinsteiger has worked as an on-air football analyst for German television broadcaster <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ARD_(broadcaster)" title="ARD (broadcaster)">ARD</a> and its weekend programme <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sportschau" title="Sportschau">Sportschau</a></i>.<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-6"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>6<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<meta property="mw:PageProp/toc">
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Club_career">Club career</h2></div>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Bayern_Munich">Bayern Munich</h3></div>
<p>Schweinsteiger signed with <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_Bayern_Munich" title="FC Bayern Munich">FC Bayern Munich</a> as a youth team player on 1 July 1998<sup id="cite_ref-Bayern_Profile_2-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-Bayern_Profile-2"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>2<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and rose through the club's youth sides. A talented youth ski racer, he had to decide between pursuing a professional career in skiing or one in football.<sup id="cite_ref-Bastian_Schweinsteiger,_Mr._Never_Say_Die_7-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-Bastian_Schweinsteiger,_Mr._Never_Say_Die-7"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>7<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Having won the German youth championship in July 2002, Schweinsteiger quickly earned a place in the reserves,<sup id="cite_ref-8" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-8"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>8<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> producing a string of solid third-division displays. He initially earned a reputation for being a rebel off the pitch, making headlines for the wrong reasons but has since settled down.<sup id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-9"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>9<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-left" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bastian_Schweinsteiger_2007-12-15.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Bastian Schweinsteiger - Wikipedia_files/Bastian_Schweinsteiger_2007-12-15.jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="277" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e7/Bastian_Schweinsteiger_2007-12-15.jpg/330px-Bastian_Schweinsteiger_2007-12-15.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e7/Bastian_Schweinsteiger_2007-12-15.jpg 2x" data-file-width="331" data-file-height="483"></a><figcaption>Schweinsteiger playing for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_Bayern_Munich" title="FC Bayern Munich">Bayern Munich</a> in 2007</figcaption></figure>
<p>During his first appearances in the titular eleven, he played left-back. After just two training sessions with the first team, coach <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ottmar_Hitzfeld" title="Ottmar Hitzfeld">Ottmar Hitzfeld</a> gave Schweinsteiger his debut, at the age of 18,<sup id="cite_ref-Bastian_Schweinsteiger,_Mr._Never_Say_Die_7-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-Bastian_Schweinsteiger,_Mr._Never_Say_Die-7"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>7<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> as a late substitute in a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a> game against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RC_Lens" title="RC Lens">RC Lens</a> in November 2002, and the youngster made an immediate impact, creating a goal for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markus_Feulner" title="Markus Feulner">Markus Feulner</a> within minutes.<sup id="cite_ref-10" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-10"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>10<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He signed a professional contract the following month and went on to appear in 14 Bundesliga games in 2002–03, helping Bayern to a league and cup double. The next season, he played 26 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bundesliga" title="Bundesliga">Bundesliga</a> games. He scored his first Bayern goal against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VfL_Wolfsburg" title="VfL Wolfsburg">VfL Wolfsburg</a> in September 2003.<sup id="cite_ref-11" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-11"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>11<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Surprisingly sent back to Bayern's reserve team by new coach <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Felix_Magath" title="Felix Magath">Felix Magath</a> at the beginning of the 2004–05 season, Schweinsteiger swiftly returned to play a role in the double-winning campaign and scored his inaugural <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">Champions League</a> goal in Bayern's <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2004%E2%80%9305_UEFA_Champions_League_knockout_stage" title="2004–05 UEFA Champions League knockout stage">quarter-final</a> first leg defeat at <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chelsea_F.C." title="Chelsea F.C.">Chelsea</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-12" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-12"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>12<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Over the next three seasons, up until the end of 2007–08, Schweinsteiger made 135 appearances in all competitions for Bayern Munich (Champions League, Bundesliga and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DFB-Pokal" title="DFB-Pokal">DFB-Pokal</a>), scoring 10 goals in the process.
</p><p>On 15 August 2008, Schweinsteiger scored the first Bundesliga goal of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2008%E2%80%9309_Bundesliga" title="2008–09 Bundesliga">2008–09 season</a>. In December that year, he extended his contract until 2012.<sup id="cite_ref-13" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-13"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>13<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Two years later, in December 2010, he extended his contract with Bayern until 2016, with the announcement came at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allianz_Arena" title="Allianz Arena">Allianz Arena</a> following a 3–0 victory over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_St._Pauli" title="FC St. Pauli">St. Pauli</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-14" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-14"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>14<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bastian_Schweinsteiger_2013-01-04.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Bastian Schweinsteiger - Wikipedia_files/250px-Bastian_Schweinsteiger_2013-01-04.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="234" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/91/Bastian_Schweinsteiger_2013-01-04.jpg/500px-Bastian_Schweinsteiger_2013-01-04.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="1800" data-file-height="1686"></a><figcaption>Schweinsteiger training with Bayern Munich in 2013</figcaption></figure>
<p>On 25 April 2012, Schweinsteiger scored from the last and match-clinching penalty kick against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Real_Madrid_C.F." class="mw-redirect" title="Real Madrid C.F.">Real Madrid</a> to send Bayern through to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_UEFA_Champions_League_Final" class="mw-redirect" title="2012 UEFA Champions League Final">2012 UEFA Champions League Final</a>, where they would face Chelsea. The match, played at Bayern's Allianz Arena, ended 1–1 and went to a penalty shoot-out. With the shoot-out poised at 3–3, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Petr_%C4%8Cech" title="Petr Čech">Petr Čech</a> tipped Schweinsteiger's shot onto the post, allowing <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Didier_Drogba" title="Didier Drogba">Didier Drogba</a> to seal the title for Chelsea with the next kick.<sup id="cite_ref-15" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-15"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>15<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In the 2012–13 season, Schweinsteiger performed considerably well, continuing his duties as central midfielder along with new signing <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Javi_Mart%C3%ADnez" title="Javi Martínez">Javi Martínez</a>. On 6 April 2013, Schweinsteiger scored a backheel flick goal against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eintracht_Frankfurt" title="Eintracht Frankfurt">Eintracht Frankfurt</a> which sealed the Bundesliga title for Bayern.<sup id="cite_ref-16" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-16"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>16<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The season ended on a high for Schweinsteiger, as Bayern secured a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Treble_(association_football)" title="Treble (association football)">treble</a> of Bundesliga, DFB-Pokal and Champions League.<sup id="cite_ref-17" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-17"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>17<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Schweinsteiger received the 2013 German player of the year due to his performance for Bayern Munich.<sup id="cite_ref-2013PotY_18-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-2013PotY-18"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>18<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-winner_2013_19-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-winner_2013-19"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>19<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He was described by then manager <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jupp_Heynckes" title="Jupp Heynckes">Jupp Heynckes</a> as the best midfielder in the world and Heynckes wanted either Schweinsteiger, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Rib%C3%A9ry" class="mw-redirect" title="Frank Ribéry">Frank Ribéry</a> or <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_M%C3%BCller" title="Thomas Müller">Thomas Müller</a> to win the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or" title="FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-20" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-20"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>20<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>He scored an equaliser goal in the match against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United</a> in the first leg of their <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2013–14 UEFA Champions League">2013–14 UEFA Champions League</a> quarter-final at <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old_Trafford" title="Old Trafford">Old Trafford</a> but saw a red card later in that match.<sup id="cite_ref-21" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-21"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>21<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-22" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-22"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>22<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>He made his <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_FC_Bayern_Munich_season" title="2014–15 FC Bayern Munich season">2014–15 season</a> debut<sup id="cite_ref-23" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-23"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>23<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> in a 4–0 win against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TSG_1899_Hoffenheim" title="TSG 1899 Hoffenheim">1899 Hoffenheim</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-24" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-24"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>24<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He came in for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mario_G%C3%B6tze" title="Mario Götze">Mario Götze</a> in the 78th minute.<sup id="cite_ref-25" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-25"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>25<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 16 May 2015, with Bayern having already won the league, he scored the opening goal in a 2–1 defeat at <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SC_Freiburg" title="SC Freiburg">SC Freiburg</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-26" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-26"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>26<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 23 May 2015, Schweinsteiger scored on his 500th appearance for Bayern.<sup id="cite_ref-27" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-27"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>27<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> This proved to be his last match with the club. He transferred to Manchester United on 13 July 2015,<sup id="cite_ref-Bastian_Schweinsteiger_and_Morgan_Schneiderlin_join_Man_Utd_28-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-Bastian_Schweinsteiger_and_Morgan_Schneiderlin_join_Man_Utd-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> having been at Bayern for 17 years.<sup id="cite_ref-29" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-29"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>29<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Schweinsteiger was a fan favourite at Bayern and was usually called <i>Fußballgott</i> (football god) by Bayern's fans.<sup id="cite_ref-30" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-30"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>30<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Manchester_United">Manchester United</h3></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-left" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bastian_Schweinsteiger_-_July_2015_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Bastian Schweinsteiger - Wikipedia_files/Bastian_Schweinsteiger_-_July_2015_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="279" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Bastian_Schweinsteiger_-_July_2015_%28cropped%29.jpg/330px-Bastian_Schweinsteiger_-_July_2015_%28cropped%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Bastian_Schweinsteiger_-_July_2015_%28cropped%29.jpg/500px-Bastian_Schweinsteiger_-_July_2015_%28cropped%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1795" data-file-height="2640"></a><figcaption>Schweinsteiger playing for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manchester_United" class="mw-redirect" title="Manchester United">Manchester United</a> in 2015</figcaption></figure>
<p>On 13 July 2015, Manchester United completed the signing of Schweinsteiger on a three-year contract for a fee of €9&nbsp;million (£6.5&nbsp;million).<sup id="cite_ref-31" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-31"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>31<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Manchester United had never before fielded a German in the first team; <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markus_Neumayr" title="Markus Neumayr">Markus Neumayr</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ron-Robert_Zieler" title="Ron-Robert Zieler">Ron-Robert Zieler</a> were at the club before him, but neither made it into the first team.<sup id="cite_ref-32" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-32"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>32<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Schweinsteiger was given shirt number 23 in pre-season, but switched to 31, which he wore at Bayern, before the official start to the season.<sup id="cite_ref-33" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-33"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>33<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Schweinsteiger made his pre-season debut for Manchester United in a friendly match against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Club_Am%C3%A9rica" title="Club América">Club América</a> on 17 July 2015.<sup id="cite_ref-34" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-34"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>34<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> United defeated the Mexican club 1–0 in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seattle" title="Seattle">Seattle</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-35" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-35"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>35<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Premier_League" title="Premier League">Premier League</a> debut came on 8 August, as a 60th-minute substitute for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Carrick" title="Michael Carrick">Michael Carrick</a> as the season began with a 1–0 home victory over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tottenham_Hotspur_F.C." title="Tottenham Hotspur F.C.">Tottenham Hotspur</a>, being booked eight minutes into his first appearance for a foul on <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nacer_Chadli" title="Nacer Chadli">Nacer Chadli</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-36" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-36"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>36<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 28 November he scored his first goal for the club, equalising with a header in a 1–1 draw against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leicester_City" class="mw-redirect" title="Leicester City">Leicester City</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-37" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-37"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>On 7 December 2015, Schweinsteiger was punished with a three-match retrospective ban by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Football_Association" title="The Football Association">The Football Association</a> for striking <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Ham_United" class="mw-redirect" title="West Ham United">West Ham United</a>'s <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winston_Reid" title="Winston Reid">Winston Reid</a> in the throat in their meeting two days earlier.<sup id="cite_ref-38" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-38"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>38<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In January 2016, he sustained a knee injury which sidelined him for two months, followed by medial knee ligament damage in mid-March which kept him off the field for the remainder of the season.<sup id="cite_ref-39" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-39"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>39<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>After the arrival of new manager, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Mourinho" title="José Mourinho">José Mourinho</a>, Schweinsteiger was demoted and sent to training with the under-23 team.<sup id="cite_ref-40" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-40"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>40<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> A number of high-profile former teammates have criticised Mourinho's handling of the matter, accusing Mourinho of showing a lack of respect for Schweinsteiger.<sup id="cite_ref-41" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-41"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>41<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He returned to first team training towards the end of 2016, and made his first appearance since March when he came on as a late substitute in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/EFL_Cup" title="EFL Cup">EFL Cup</a> quarter-final against West Ham United on 30 November 2016.<sup id="cite_ref-42" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-42"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>42<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He made his first start in over a year in a 4–0 win in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FA_Cup" title="FA Cup">FA Cup</a> fourth round home tie against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wigan_Athletic_F.C." title="Wigan Athletic F.C.">Wigan Athletic</a> on 29 January 2017, in which he scored his first Old Trafford goal for Manchester United with an overhead finish.<sup id="cite_ref-43" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-43"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>43<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> For his goal, as well as his assist to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marouane_Fellaini" title="Marouane Fellaini">Marouane Fellaini</a> for the opening goal, he was voted "Man of the Match" by the fans.<sup id="cite_ref-44" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-44"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>44<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Chicago_Fire">Chicago Fire</h3></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:CINvCHI_2017-06-28_-_Bastian_Schweinsteiger_(27329406048)_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Bastian Schweinsteiger - Wikipedia_files/250px-CINvCHI_2017-06-28_-_Bastian_Schweinsteiger_(27329406048)_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="267" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/be/CINvCHI_2017-06-28_-_Bastian_Schweinsteiger_%2827329406048%29_%28cropped%29.jpg/330px-CINvCHI_2017-06-28_-_Bastian_Schweinsteiger_%2827329406048%29_%28cropped%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/be/CINvCHI_2017-06-28_-_Bastian_Schweinsteiger_%2827329406048%29_%28cropped%29.jpg/500px-CINvCHI_2017-06-28_-_Bastian_Schweinsteiger_%2827329406048%29_%28cropped%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1891" data-file-height="2654"></a><figcaption>Schweinsteiger playing for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago_Fire_Soccer_Club" class="mw-redirect" title="Chicago Fire Soccer Club">Chicago Fire</a> in 2017</figcaption></figure>
<p>On 21 March 2017, Manchester United allowed Schweinsteiger to join <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_League_Soccer" title="Major League Soccer">Major League Soccer</a> side <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago_Fire_Soccer_Club" class="mw-redirect" title="Chicago Fire Soccer Club">Chicago Fire</a>, subject to a medical and a visa being secured.<sup id="cite_ref-45" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-45"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>45<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-46" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-46"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>46<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-47" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-47"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>47<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The move was completed on 29 March.<sup id="cite_ref-48" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-48"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>48<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> A few days later, Mourinho stated that he "regretted" the way he had treated Schweinsteiger.<sup id="cite_ref-49" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-49"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>49<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 1 April, Schweinsteiger debuted for Chicago Fire, scoring in a 2–2 home draw against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Montreal_Impact_(2012%E2%80%932020)" class="mw-redirect" title="Montreal Impact (2012–2020)">Montreal Impact</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-50" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-50"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>50<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> By mid-season, he would help guide Chicago to the top of the MLS standings and be voted into the "MLS All-Star Fan XI" (along with teammate <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nemanja_Nikoli%C4%87_(footballer,_born_1987)" title="Nemanja Nikolić (footballer, born 1987)">Nemanja Nikolić</a>) to face Real Madrid at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2017_MLS_All-Star_Game" title="2017 MLS All-Star Game">2017 MLS All-Star Game</a> in Chicago.<sup id="cite_ref-51" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-51"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>51<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> After guiding the Fire back into the playoffs after a five-year drought, Schweinsteiger was awarded the contract option of another year in 2018.<sup id="cite_ref-52" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-52"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>52<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Schweinsteiger netted a goal and also provided an assist to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alan_Gordon_(soccer)" title="Alan Gordon (soccer)">Alan Gordon</a>'s equalising goal in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Injury_time" class="mw-redirect" title="Injury time">stoppage time</a> in a 2–2 draw against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toronto_FC" title="Toronto FC">Toronto FC</a> on 29 April 2018.<sup id="cite_ref-53" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-53"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>53<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 5 August, he scored a long-range goal to level the scoreline after coming on as a substitute in the second half, but his side were defeated in a 2–1 away loss against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Real_Salt_Lake" title="Real Salt Lake">Real Salt Lake</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-54" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-54"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>54<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-55" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-55"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>55<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 11 July, Schweinsteiger scored a goal in the stoppage time and provided one assist to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aleksandar_Katai" title="Aleksandar Katai">Aleksandar Katai</a>'s goal in a 4–3 home defeat against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philadelphia_Union" title="Philadelphia Union">Philadelphia Union</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-56" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-56"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>56<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Retirement">Retirement</h3></div>
<p>On 8 October 2019, Schweinsteiger announced his retirement from professional football.<sup id="cite_ref-57" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-57"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>57<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> A few days after his retirement from active sports in October 2019, the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ARD_(broadcaster)" title="ARD (broadcaster)">ARD</a> announced that Schweinsteiger would be accompanying live broadcasts of football matches as an expert in Qatar for the next three years up to and including the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2022 FIFA World Cup">2022 FIFA World Cup</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-58" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-58"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>58<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="International_career">International career</h2></div>
<p>On 6 June 2004, Schweinsteiger debuted for the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_national_football_team" title="Germany national football team">German senior squad</a> in a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exhibition_game" title="Exhibition game">friendly match</a> against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hungary_national_football_team" title="Hungary national football team">Hungary</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-59" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-59"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>59<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He was part of the Germany squad for every major tournament from UEFA Euro 2004 until Euro 2016.<sup id="cite_ref-Bastian_Schweinsteiger,_Mr._Never_Say_Die_7-2" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-Bastian_Schweinsteiger,_Mr._Never_Say_Die-7"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>7<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Euro_2004">Euro 2004</h3></div>
<p>Right after taking part in the under-21s' disappointing run at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2004_UEFA_European_Under-21_Football_Championship" class="mw-redirect" title="2004 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship">2004 European Championships</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-60" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-60"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>60<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> he was called up for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2004" title="UEFA Euro 2004">Euro 2004</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-61" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-61"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>61<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He set up the opening goal for Bayern teammate <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Ballack" title="Michael Ballack">Michael Ballack</a> in Germany's 2–1 loss against the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Czech_Republic_national_football_team" title="Czech Republic national football team">Czech Republic</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-62" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-62"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>62<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="2005_FIFA_Confederations_Cup_and_2006_FIFA_World_Cup">2005 FIFA Confederations Cup and 2006 FIFA World Cup</h3></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Confed-Cup_2005_Er%C3%B6ffnungsspiel_(Eckball_Schweinsteiger).JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Bastian Schweinsteiger - Wikipedia_files/250px-Confed-Cup_2005_Eröffnungsspiel_(Eckball_Schweinsteiger).JPG" decoding="async" width="250" height="188" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/86/Confed-Cup_2005_Er%C3%B6ffnungsspiel_%28Eckball_Schweinsteiger%29.JPG/500px-Confed-Cup_2005_Er%C3%B6ffnungsspiel_%28Eckball_Schweinsteiger%29.JPG 1.5x" data-file-width="2592" data-file-height="1944"></a><figcaption>Schweinsteiger preparing to take a corner kick for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_national_football_team" title="Germany national football team">Germany</a> during the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2005_FIFA_Confederations_Cup" title="2005 FIFA Confederations Cup">2005 FIFA Confederations Cup</a></figcaption></figure>
<p>He scored his first two international goals on 8 June 2005 against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia_national_football_team" title="Russia national football team">Russia</a><sup id="cite_ref-Bastian_Schweinsteiger,_Mr._Never_Say_Die_7-3" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-Bastian_Schweinsteiger,_Mr._Never_Say_Die-7"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>7<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and scored his first goal in a competitive match against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tunisia_national_football_team" title="Tunisia national football team">Tunisia</a> on 18 June 2005 at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Confederations_Cup_2005" class="mw-redirect" title="Confederations Cup 2005">Confederations Cup</a> in Germany.<sup id="cite_ref-63" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-63"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>63<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He was called up to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2006_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2006 FIFA World Cup">2006 FIFA World Cup</a> on home soil and shot into prominence at the tournament with his two brilliant long-range strikes in the third-place match against Portugal, which won him the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Man_of_the_Match" class="mw-redirect" title="Man of the Match">Man of the Match</a> award.<sup id="cite_ref-64" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-64"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>64<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The match ended 3–1 with the 21-year-old nearly claiming a hat-trick but his deflected free kick was credited as an own goal to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armando_Petit" class="mw-redirect" title="Armando Petit">Armando Petit</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-65" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-65"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>65<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Euro_2008">Euro 2008</h3></div>
<p>During <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2008_qualifying_Group_D" title="UEFA Euro 2008 qualifying Group D">Euro 2008 qualifiers</a>, Schweinsteiger scored two goals en route to a record 13–0 win over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Marino_national_football_team" title="San Marino national football team">San Marino</a> in San Marino.<sup id="cite_ref-66" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-66"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>66<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He scored the third goal in Germany's 4–1 win over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slovakia_national_football_team" title="Slovakia national football team">Slovakia</a> in Bratislava.<sup id="cite_ref-67" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-67"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>67<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Schweinsteiger lost his place in the starting 11 when Germany manager <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joachim_L%C3%B6w" title="Joachim Löw">Joachim Löw</a> moved striker <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski" title="Lukas Podolski">Lukas Podolski</a> to Schweinsteiger's usual position on the left wing to accommodate the strike partnership of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miroslav_Klose" title="Miroslav Klose">Miroslav Klose</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mario_G%C3%B3mez" title="Mario Gómez">Mario Gómez</a>, and he made two substitute appearances in the group stage. In the second match against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Croatia_national_football_team" title="Croatia national football team">Croatia</a>, he was shown a straight red card for reacting to a challenge from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerko_Leko" title="Jerko Leko">Jerko Leko</a> as Germany succumbed to a shock 2–1 defeat.<sup id="cite_ref-68" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-68"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>68<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> After serving his suspension by missing the game against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austria_national_football_team" title="Austria national football team">Austria</a>, he returned to the starting line-up in the quarterfinal against Portugal, as Löw reverted to the old 4–4–2 formation when Gómez was benched after failing to make an impression. Once again he was instrumental in Germany's 3–2 win, scoring one goal and setting up the other two.<sup id="cite_ref-69" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-69"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>69<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He also scored his country's first goal in the 3–2 semifinal victory against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey_national_football_team" title="Turkey national football team">Turkey</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-70" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-70"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>70<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He captained the team for the first time in a friendly against the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Arab_Emirates_national_football_team" title="United Arab Emirates national football team">United Arab Emirates</a>.
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="2010_FIFA_World_Cup">2010 FIFA World Cup</h3></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bastian_Schweinsteiger.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Bastian Schweinsteiger - Wikipedia_files/Bastian_Schweinsteiger.jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="278" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/Bastian_Schweinsteiger.jpg/330px-Bastian_Schweinsteiger.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/Bastian_Schweinsteiger.jpg/500px-Bastian_Schweinsteiger.jpg 2x" data-file-width="532" data-file-height="778"></a><figcaption>Schweinsteiger striking the ball for Germany during a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_%E2%80%93_UEFA_Group_4" title="2010 FIFA World Cup qualification – UEFA Group 4">2010 FIFA World Cup qualifier</a> against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia_national_football_team" title="Russia national football team">Russia</a> in 2009</figcaption></figure>
<p>Schweinsteiger featured often in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_(UEFA)" title="2010 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)">2010 World Cup qualifying</a>, playing nine of the 10 games and contributing three goals. He started in Germany's third pre-warm-up game vs. Bosnia on 3 June 2010, and scored two penalties in a 3–1 victory in the space of four minutes, but in the 87th minute he was substituted off for Bayern Munich teammate <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toni_Kroos" title="Toni Kroos">Toni Kroos</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-71" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-71"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>71<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>During the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2010 FIFA World Cup">2010 FIFA World Cup</a>, Schweinsteiger was charged with replacing the injured <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Ballack" title="Michael Ballack">Michael Ballack</a> at the centre of midfield. He performed admirably in this role, adding valuable leadership and international experience to a very young German side. He was vital to both the German attack and defence, as was apparent when he was named the Man of the Match after the quarter-final match against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team" title="Argentina national football team">Argentina</a>, where he provided two assists while also managing to contain <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-72" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-72"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>72<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Germany subsequently lost to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain_national_football_team" title="Spain national football team">Spain</a> in the semi-finals.<sup id="cite_ref-73" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-73"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>73<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Germany was able to rally for a 3–2 victory over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uruguay_national_football_team" title="Uruguay national football team">Uruguay</a> in the third-place match, and, with <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philipp_Lahm" title="Philipp Lahm">Philipp Lahm</a> resting on the bench because of illness, Schweinsteiger served as captain.<sup id="cite_ref-74" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-74"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>74<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Overall, Schweinsteiger recorded three assists in seven matches in South Africa, which tied him for the most assists in the finals with <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dirk_Kuyt" title="Dirk Kuyt">Dirk Kuyt</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kak%C3%A1" title="Kaká">Kaká</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_M%C3%BCller" title="Thomas Müller">Thomas Müller</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mesut_%C3%96zil" title="Mesut Özil">Mesut Özil</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-75" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-75"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>75<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In recognition of his excellent play throughout the tournament, he was chosen as one of 10 finalists for the prestigious <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_Ball_(FIFA)" class="mw-redirect" title="Golden Ball (FIFA)">Golden Ball</a>, awarded to the most outstanding player of the tournament.<sup id="cite_ref-76" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-76"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>76<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Euro_2012">Euro 2012</h3></div>
<p>Schweinsteiger established himself as first choice as defensive midfielder in Germany's <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2012_qualifying_Group_A" title="UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying Group A">qualifying group</a>. He played five matches – once against each opponent: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belgium_national_football_team" title="Belgium national football team">Belgium</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Azerbaijan_national_football_team" title="Azerbaijan national football team">Azerbaijan</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kazakhstan_national_football_team" title="Kazakhstan national football team">Kazakhstan</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austria_national_football_team" title="Austria national football team">Austria</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey_national_football_team" title="Turkey national football team">Turkey</a> – and helped Germany win 10 out of 10 games, scoring once and providing one assist.
</p><p>Schweinsteiger started all five of Germany's matches at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2012" title="UEFA Euro 2012">UEFA Euro 2012</a> finals and assisted both of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mario_G%C3%B3mez" title="Mario Gómez">Mario Gómez</a> goals in the 2–1 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2012_Group_B" title="UEFA Euro 2012 Group B">Group B</a> win over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany%E2%80%93Netherlands_football_rivalry" title="Germany–Netherlands football rivalry">rivals</a> the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netherlands_national_football_team" title="Netherlands national football team">Netherlands</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-77" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-77"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>77<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="2014_FIFA_World_Cup">2014 FIFA World Cup</h3></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bastian_Schweinsteiger_celebrates_at_the_2014_FIFA_World_Cup_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Bastian Schweinsteiger - Wikipedia_files/Bastian_Schweinsteiger_celebrates_at_the_2014_FIFA_World_Cup_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="311" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/74/Bastian_Schweinsteiger_celebrates_at_the_2014_FIFA_World_Cup_%28cropped%29.jpg/500px-Bastian_Schweinsteiger_celebrates_at_the_2014_FIFA_World_Cup_%28cropped%29.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="1821" data-file-height="2263"></a><figcaption>Schweinsteiger celebrating with the World Cup trophy after winning the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_final" title="2014 FIFA World Cup final">2014 FIFA World Cup final</a></figcaption></figure>
<p>Schweinsteiger made five appearances as Germany <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_%E2%80%93_UEFA_Group_C" title="2014 FIFA World Cup qualification – UEFA Group C">qualified</a> for the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 FIFA World Cup</a>. On 15 October 2013, he won his <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_men%27s_footballers_with_100_or_more_international_caps" title="List of men&#39;s footballers with 100 or more international caps">100th cap</a> for the national team in a 5–3 win over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sweden_men%27s_national_football_team" title="Sweden men&#39;s national football team">Sweden</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-78" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-78"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>78<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>After making a substitute appearance in the team's second match against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ghana_national_football_team" title="Ghana national football team">Ghana</a>, Schweinsteiger was selected to start in the third group game against the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_men%27s_national_soccer_team" title="United States men&#39;s national soccer team">United States</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-79" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-79"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>79<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He retained his place in the team for Germany's <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#Round_of_16" title="2014 FIFA World Cup knockout stage">round of 16</a> match, a 2–1 win against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algeria_national_football_team" title="Algeria national football team">Algeria</a>. He was instrumental in the World Cup finals against Argentina and led the mid-field with sweeping passes for the German attack. Germany won the World Cup final 1–0 through <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mario_G%C3%B6tze" title="Mario Götze">Mario Götze</a>'s 113th-minute goal.<sup id="cite_ref-80" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-80"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>80<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Euro_2016_and_retirement">Euro 2016 and retirement</h3></div>
<p>Prior to the start of qualification, Schweinsteiger was appointed as the new captain for Germany after <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philipp_Lahm" title="Philipp Lahm">Philipp Lahm</a>'s retirement.<sup id="cite_ref-81" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-81"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>81<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 23 March 2016 he sustained damage on his knee while he was training with the national team which made him miss the rest of the Premier League season but he recovered just in time to be selected for Germany's 27-man provisional squad for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2016" title="UEFA Euro 2016">UEFA Euro 2016</a>. On 31 May, Schweinsteiger was selected for Germany's final 23-man squad for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2016" title="UEFA Euro 2016">UEFA Euro 2016</a>. During this time, Schweinsteiger also took part in a collaboration between the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_Football_Association" title="German Football Association">German Football Association</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_LEGO_Group" class="mw-redirect" title="The LEGO Group">The LEGO Group</a>, who in 2016 released a Europe-exclusive <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lego_Minifigures_(theme)" title="Lego Minifigures (theme)">collectible minifigure series</a>, with Schweinsteiger featured as the seventh of sixteen <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minifigure" class="mw-redirect" title="Minifigure">minifigures</a> in the collection.<sup id="cite_ref-82" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-82"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>82<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>On 12 June 2016, Schweinsteiger scored in stoppage time after coming on late in a 2–0 group stage victory over Ukraine.<sup id="cite_ref-83" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-83"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>83<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Nine days later, Schweinsteiger set a new record for German player with the most appearances in a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_European_Championship" title="UEFA European Championship">European Championship</a> match.<sup id="cite_ref-84" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-84"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>84<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> After the tournament, Schweinsteiger announced his retirement from competitive international football, having played in 120 games, scoring 24 goals.<sup id="cite_ref-85" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-85"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>85<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> One month later, he participated in his last ever international appearance for Germany, against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Finland_national_football_team" title="Finland national football team">Finland</a> in a friendly match.<sup id="cite_ref-86" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-86"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>86<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He was succeeded as captain by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manuel_Neuer" title="Manuel Neuer">Manuel Neuer</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-87" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-87"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>87<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Style_of_play">Style of play</h2></div>
<p>Schweinsteiger largely operated in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_midfielder" class="mw-redirect" title="Central midfielder">centre</a>, but he was versatile enough to provide an option on the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winger_(association_football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Winger (association football)">wing</a>, either on the left or right flank. During his years with Bayern, he was regarded as one of the best midfielders in the world. Schweinsteiger possessed a fearsome shot from range, as well as excellent <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross_(association_football)" title="Cross (association football)">crossing</a> and a wicked delivery from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Set_piece_(football)" title="Set piece (football)">set-pieces</a>, while his boundless energy also served him well.<sup id="cite_ref-88" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-88"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>88<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-warrior_89-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-warrior-89"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>89<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Described as a "two-way player" by Nick Amies, he was also used in a variety of other roles, including as a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holding_midfielder" class="mw-redirect" title="Holding midfielder">holding midfielder</a>, as an <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attacking_midfielder" class="mw-redirect" title="Attacking midfielder">attacking midfielder</a>, in a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Box-to-box" class="mw-redirect" title="Box-to-box">box-to-box</a> role, as a playmaker, and in a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Playmaker#Deep-lying_playmakers" title="Playmaker">deep-lying midfield</a> role.<sup id="cite_ref-Profiling_90-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-Profiling-90"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>90<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Bayern&#39;s_elegant,_powerful_midfielder_Bastian_Schweinsteiger_91-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-Bayern&#39;s_elegant,_powerful_midfielder_Bastian_Schweinsteiger-91"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>91<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Fire_sign_Schweinsteiger_92-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-Fire_sign_Schweinsteiger-92"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>92<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-midfield_general_93-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-midfield_general-93"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>93<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-94" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-94"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>94<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> A powerful, physical, and elegant player, who also possessed good technique, skill, passing ability, vision, and creativity, Schweinsteiger was known for his ability to control and dictate the flow of his team's play in midfield, build attacks, and create chances for his teammates with his distribution.<sup id="cite_ref-Profiling_90-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-Profiling-90"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>90<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Bayern&#39;s_elegant,_powerful_midfielder_Bastian_Schweinsteiger_91-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-Bayern&#39;s_elegant,_powerful_midfielder_Bastian_Schweinsteiger-91"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>91<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Fire_sign_Schweinsteiger_92-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-Fire_sign_Schweinsteiger-92"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>92<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-midfield_general_93-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-midfield_general-93"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>93<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-95" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-95"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>95<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-96" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-96"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>96<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-97" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-97"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>97<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Dubbed the "Midfield Motor",<sup id="cite_ref-98" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-98"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>98<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Schweinsteiger was also a superb reader of the game and scored spectacularly due to his good positioning. He was called "the brain" of the German national team by coach <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joachim_L%C3%B6w" title="Joachim Löw">Joachim Löw</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-99" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-99"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>99<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and was also described as a "midfield mastermind".<sup id="cite_ref-dw.de_100-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-dw.de-100"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>100<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Beyond his offensive and creative capabilities, he was also known for his defensive skills, work-rate, and tackling ability.<sup id="cite_ref-colossus_101-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-colossus-101"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>101<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> For his performances, he was voted as the best German player of the year in 2013.<sup id="cite_ref-dw.de_100-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-dw.de-100"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>100<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jonathan_Wilson_(writer)" title="Jonathan Wilson (writer)">Jonathan Wilson</a>, when writing for <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Guardian" title="The Guardian">The Guardian</a></i> during the same year, labelled Schweinsteiger as a type holding midfielder that he described as a "carrier" or "surger," namely "a player capable of making late runs or carrying the ball at his feet."<sup id="cite_ref-WilsonHolding13_102-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-WilsonHolding13-102"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>102<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> During his time with Chicago, Schweinsteiger was also occasionally deployed as a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_defender" class="mw-redirect" title="Central defender">central defender</a> or <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sweeper_(association_football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Sweeper (association football)">sweeper</a> in a three-man back-line, in addition to his usual role in midfield, courtesy of his vision and defensive skills; in this deeper role, he was not only given defensive responsibilities, such as marking opposing players, but was also given offensive duties, and was tasked with playing the ball out from the back, retaining possession, advancing into midfield, and controlling the play.<sup id="cite_ref-103" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-103"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>103<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-104" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-104"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>104<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-105" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-105"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>105<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Because of Schweinsteiger's wide range of skills, his former Chicago Fire manager, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Veljko_Paunovi%C4%87" title="Veljko Paunović">Veljko Paunović</a>, described him upon his retirement in 2019 as "unique and special," also commenting: "He's a complete player, a total player. In Germany, where they know him even better than us, they call him a 'Fussballgott' [a "football god," in German] because he represents everything."<sup id="cite_ref-106" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-106"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>106<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Personal_life">Personal life</h2></div>
<p>Schweinsteiger is a Roman Catholic.<sup id="cite_ref-107" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-107"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>107<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He is known to fans as "Schweini" or "Basti", the latter to distinguish him from his elder brother, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tobias_Schweinsteiger" title="Tobias Schweinsteiger">Tobias</a>, a professional footballer who also played for Bayern Munich, albeit in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_Bayern_Munich_II" title="FC Bayern Munich II">reserve team</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-108" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-108"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>108<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Schweinsteiger was in a relationship with model Sarah Brandner from 2007 until July 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-dating-ivanovic_109-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-dating-ivanovic-109"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>109<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> They lived in Munich together.<sup id="cite_ref-110" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-110"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>110<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In September 2014, he began a relationship with Serbian tennis player <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ana_Ivanovic" title="Ana Ivanovic">Ana Ivanovic</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-dating-ivanovic_109-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-dating-ivanovic-109"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>109<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-111" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-111"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>111<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The couple married on 12 July 2016 in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venice" title="Venice">Venice</a>, Italy.<sup id="cite_ref-112" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-112"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>112<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> They have two sons, born in 2018<sup id="cite_ref-113" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-113"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>113<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-114" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-114"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>114<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and 2019.<sup id="cite_ref-115" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-115"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>115<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In February 2023, the couple announced that they were expecting their third child together.<sup id="cite_ref-116" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-116"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>116<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Schweinsteiger was a talented ski racer and is childhood friends with <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Felix_Neureuther" title="Felix Neureuther">Felix Neureuther</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-117" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger#cite_note-117"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>117<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
